page.title: 11Housing
page.content: A wide variety of housing was found, from flats and maisonettes to detached homes. Most houses were semi-detached or terraced, built just before the (second) war. The oldest housing found was 175 years old and was terraced. This was in the older town part of our area. The newest properties were 2 and 3 bedroomed semi-detached or terraced houses built in small closes by large private developers which filled spaces between other areas of housing. Many properties were council owned, although some of these had been purchased by their tenants. Some houses were pebble-dashed or faced in decorative brick but most were built of red brick, particularly the council houses. most of the houses had small gardens but few had garages - these were often away from the housing in small rented blocks.
